body_html:
I compile tensorflow source code and use it on two different servers
compile:

  • Linux version 2.6.32-431.el6.x86_64(redhat 4.4.7)
  • gcc4.8.5
  • bazel0.9.0
  • TensorFlow installed from github(https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/releases?after=v1.5.1)
  • TensorFlow 1.4.0
  • CUDA Version 8.0.61 /cuDNN: CUDNN_MAJOR 5
  • GPU:Tesla K40m Memory:11439MiB

use:

  • Linux version 2.6.32-279.el6.x86_64(redhat 4.4.6)
  • gcc4.4.6 (but i use it with libstdc++.so.6)

I write a dome that just create a session and run it. After my datas have been recycled many times, the program crashed. I supervised the memory and it is stable.
The crash happened in the libtensorflow_framework.so. I don't konw how it works.

compile:

Linux version 2.6.32-431.el6.x86_64(redhat 4.4.7)
gcc4.8.5
bazel0.9.0

TensorFlow 1.4.0
CUDA Version 8.0.61  /cuDNN: CUDNN_MAJOR  5
GPU:Tesla K40m  Memory:11439MiB

use:

Linux version 2.6.32-279.el6.x86_64(redhat 4.4.6)
gcc4.4.6 (but i use it with libstdc++.so.6)

I write a dome that just create a session and run it. After my datas have been recycled many times, the program crashed. I supervised the memory and it is stable.
The crash happened in the libtensorflow_framework.so. I don't konw how it works.
body:
I compile tensorflow source code and use it on two different servers
**compile:**
- Linux version 2.6.32-431.el6.x86_64(redhat 4.4.7)
- gcc4.8.5
- bazel0.9.0
- TensorFlow installed from github(https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/releases?after=v1.5.1)
- TensorFlow 1.4.0
- CUDA Version 8.0.61  /cuDNN: CUDNN_MAJOR  5
- GPU:Tesla K40m  Memory:11439MiB

**use:**
- Linux version 2.6.32-279.el6.x86_64(redhat 4.4.6)
- gcc4.4.6 (but i use it with libstdc++.so.6)

I write a dome that just create a session and run it. After my datas have been recycled many times, the program crashed. I supervised the memory and it is stable.
The crash happened in the libtensorflow_framework.so. I don't konw how it works.
